other_tests.findings: Treponema pallidum genomic DNA fragments encoding DNA polymerase I were detected.
Scattered dyskeratotic cells in the epidermis, vacuolar degeneration of the basal cells, and lymphoid infiltration along the dermoepidermal junction.
High VDRL titer in newborn serum (1:256) and reactive VDRL in cerebrospinal fluid (1:32) indicating neurosyphilis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: VDRL titer decreased to 1:4 after 3 months and became 1:1 one year later.
